alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 3:10PM MST until September 21 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. .Heavy rainfall Monday in the upper reaches of the Gila River in New Mexico has resulted in a significant flow in the Gila River. The Gila River at Virden continues to rapidly rise, and expected to reach flood stage this evening, with this peak flow making its way into Arizona near Duncan overnight tonight. Additional rainfall to the area this evening and Wednesday will drain into the Gila River basin, increasing the already heavy flow. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan, Gila River At Kelvin, Gila River at Calva, Gila River near Solomon, San Carlos Reservoir at Coolidge Dam...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...From this afternoon to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, water could begin to damage the dike structure that protects Duncan. At 18.0 feet, water has reached bankfull. Water near the top of the dike structure and may start causing erosion downstream of bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM MST Tuesday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.0 feet late this afternoon. It will rise to 17.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 500 AM MST.
